data.title: Sabyasachi Lehenga Price | How much does a Sabyasachi Lehenga Cost
data.meta_description: Picture this: a Sabyasachi lehenga, not just a lehenga but a dream woven with exquisite craftsmanship, coveted by brides far and wide. Every bride's desire, yet a few sigh at its unattainable beauty, ...
data.meta_site_name: WedMeGood - Best Indian Wedding Blog for Planning & Ideas.
data.text:
Picture this: a Sabyasachi lehenga, not just a lehenga but a dream woven with exquisite craftsmanship, coveted by brides far and wide. Every bride's desire, yet a few sigh at its unattainable beauty, the cost being the hurdle. Let's talk numbers, addressing the curiosity: how much does this dream lehenga really cost?

Buckle up brides, for we’re unveiling the secret behind this dreamy ensemble, demystifying the digits that make hearts skip a beat!

Sabyasachi Lehenga Cost 101: All You Need To Know

So, how much does an original Sabyasachi lehenga cost?

As of November 2023, all Sabyasachi bridal lehengas start at a price point of 5 lakhs onwards. While you can get lighter outfits and sarees for a lesser price point, the bridal lehenga range starts from INR 5 Lakhs. These do not include lighter lehengas like printed ones that you may pick for smaller functions like your Mehendi or the Sangeet.

A bridal Sabyasachi lehenga cost will vary anywhere between 5 lakhs to 15 lakhs, depending on the work and collection that you are picking from.

The super-heavy lehengas are upwards of 8 lakhs onwards.

Their lighter collection starts from 1 lakh onwards. This includes printed sarees, anarkalis and the works. It goes up to 4 lakhs.

Their couture pieces are priced higher and go up to 25 lakhs or even more, depending on the work done

Do note that Sabyasachi doesn’t customise all lehengas and doesn’t allow for mix and match so if you are planning something personalised, Sabyasachi is not the lehenga to opt for.

All of their collection will be available at their flagship stores along with multi-designer stores like Aza and Ensemble. You will get a wider variety of bridal lehenga at their store than any other store, along with lighter lehengas, accessories and the newest entrant – Sabyasachi Jewellery

25+ Sabyasachi Lehengas You Will Love

Like every year, Sabyasachi dropped a stunning collection in 2023 that made its way into our hearts! What we loved about this was the stunning mix of lehenga styles that they have introduced. From velvet stunners for winter weddings to trendy pastel beauties, they have something for all kinds of brides.

Right Out Of The Classic Sabya Guldasta Collection That Meets Wednesday Adams!

You don't need to restrict yourself to a Sabya only for your wedding day! This will make for such a stunning reception or even sangeet lehenga.

Lavender Love!

For brides who want to go pastel but wants something unique, this lavender beauty is the one to watch out for!

This Unique Dark Mocha Hued Lehenga!

A different colour, stunning work and something that can transition so well from an evening wedding followed by a reception look!

Soft Bubblegum Pink Meets Sage!

Totally digging this muted pink and sage combination that is so so different from what brides usually pick.

Starry Saree Stunner!

We are noticing brides picking up sarees for engagements and smaller events and we cannot help but fall in love with this turkish rose beauty!

Ink Blue Ishq!

What's not to love? You can style stunning statement jewellery on this monotone lehenga that we are lusting after!

Regal Charm Of Velvet Lehengas!

In the soft caress of pink velvet, the Sabyasachi lehenga whispers tales of royalty, weaving elegance and allure into every intricate stitch, a testament to timeless glamour and grace

Ivory Magic!

After he designed Alia's magical ivory saree last year, you cannot help but look for this stunning ivory lehenga that is light yet so statement like!

Red Opulence

Sabyasachi is known for his signature red bridal lehengas and this year’s collection is simply stunning. Our favourites from the range!

Timeless Gold & Red!

In a vibrant hue that commands attention, the red Sabyasachi lehenga weaves a tale of elegance and grace, adorning its wearer in timeless beauty and cultural splendor.

Monotone Magic!

In the enchanting red monotone Sabyasachi lehenga, tradition meets modernity and we simply love that!

Pink & Red Stunner!

If you are looking for some combination of colour with your bridal red lehenga, this muted pink is a stunner!

Radiant In Red

We are so so in love with those gold motifs on the lehenga with that double dupatta draping style!

Gorgeous blouse + Triangular Motif = Winner!

In the blush of a pinkish-red Sabyasachi lehenga, tradition dances with contemporary allure, painting an exquisite canvas of timeless grace and modern sophistication!

Why say no to a red Sabyasachi anarkali?

For brides who are looking out for opulent anarkalis for pre-wedding events or even an intimate wedding, this jacket style anarkali is absolutely a must-have!

Some of the best of his past collections!

Winter Wonderland

Welcome winter weddings with this beauty! A gorgeous velvet lehenga with embroidered and sequinned vintage florals and an embroidered organza dupatta

For brides who love bling without going OTT, this grey-silver and blush pink lehenga in velvet is the lehenga of your dreams!

How can you have a Sabyasachi collection without a floral lehenga? This beauty, again in velvet, is an ode to all brides who love their blooms.

Sabyasachi also released a new collection of Heritage bridal lehengas a few months ago that were designed for the true-blue traditional Sabyasachi bride.

First up is this classic lehenga in their signature shade of red. Matka silk, organza and brocade hand embroidered with zardozi, tilla work and gota tell a story of authenticity and the finest of craftsmanship.

We are also loving this mono-motif style lehenga in bridal red for that perfect bridal look

Trending this season – these horizontal panelled lehengas with stunning plunge neck blouses and organza dupattas are such a beauty!

This mix of horizontal panels with lighter work on the top, this dainty lehenga is such a pretty pick for brides who want to go big yet keep it minimal.

Bohemian Weddings

If you are a bride who likes all things boho, then this Sabyasachi lehenga collection is just perfect for you.

First up is this stunning floral lehenga in shades of pink. Big floral designs in deep pink over a lighter tone is a great pick for a day wedding.

This chevron Sabyasachi lehenga is already a big hit amongst brides, weve spotted so many of them rocking this offbeat lehenga. If you are someone who is looking for a lehenga that is a little hatke than the usual floral and embroidered patterns, then this one's for you.

Looking for a fresh hue for your bridal lehenga, then your search ends with this floral Sabyasachi lehenga in turquoise. So unique!

Nautch Nautch

Want to wear red at your wedding, but also orange, and mauve and oh mustard? For all you brides who cannot decide on what color to wear on your D-day, this collection by Sabyasachi has some really interesting pieces for you.

Vintage Pastels

Most modern brides are going for pastels. And we think it is a great choice, gone are the days where Indian brides wore only bright colors at their wedding.

This oh so pretty ivory lehenga by Sabyasachi is a dream come true. A white lehenga with hints of gold and red is ideal for brides who wish to wear this hue at their wedding.

When we talk about pastels, how can we not talk about pinks. They surely have a special place, this beautiful Sabyasachi lehenga with dull gold embroidery has to be one of our favorites.

We are clearly a little obsessed with pastel pinks. This gorgeous Sabyasachi pink lehenga with overall embroidery have a piece of our hearts.

Gulabi Raja

Spectacular is the word that came to our mind when we saw this Sabyasachi lehenga. Emerald green skirt, maroon blouse and a light pink dupatta. So different yet so pretty. Brides, didn't this one tug at your heartstrings.

Laal

How can we talk about bridal lehengas and include some traditional reds. I mean no one can really go wrong with a red lehenga for their wedding. Every bride must have once thought of dressing up in a red lehenga at their wedding, well one look at this collection by Sabyasachi can definitely convince you for this.

All the prices from all Sabyasachi collection are available on request only.

Sabyasachi Bridal Ensembles With Prices

Here are some prices for Sabyasachi lehengas and sarees which will give you an approximate idea.

Gorgeous Olive Green Chanderi Saree - INR 1.69 lakhs

Here are some prices for a few Sabyasachi lehengas as of 2023, so that you have a better idea of their cost.

Stunning Bridal Red & Gold Lehenga - INR 17 lakhs

Katrina Kaif's stunning lehenga in handwoven matka silk with fine tilla work and meticulously embroidered revival zardozi borders in velvet was a work of art.

The lehenga set came with a bold red blouse and was layered with a red veil which was custom-trimmed with handmade kiran in hand-beaten silver electroplated in gold, in homage to the groom’s Punjabi roots.

Vintage Banarasi lehenga - INR 2.65 lakhs

Sabyasachi’s Benarasi lehenga collection received much attention back in Amazon India Fashion Week. The clever combination of lehenga and banarasi won lakhs of hearts, giving a royal touch-up. If you ever speculate on the lehengas, you will notice subtle golden or silver delicate designs, which are a speciality of the kind. Higher the number of materials used, the higher is the price. The lehenga won’t give you any short of the vintage as well as aristocratic feeling.

Silk Banarasi lehenga - INR 2.65 lakhs

I bet every girl out there dreams of getting all dolled up in an emerald Sabyasachi red silk banarasi wedding lehenga, walking down to the mandap. Half of your time must be gone behind scrolling through Pinterest or Instagram, organizing that perfect wedding in your mind. Yes, we do understand this feeling. The simple yet classic lehengas are what we do crave the most. Pink ones with floral print were in great demand. It’s going to be so hard to choose one with the wide sea of assorted choices laying in front of us.

Mint embroidered lehenga set - INR 2.95 lakhs

Mint is indeed one of the prettiest colors out there. Each embroidery runs smoothly underneath the fingers and you won’t even feel the difference, the epitome of ultra-fineness. The blouse is generally customizable and you can drape the dupatta in whatever way you want and can. This is more for the smaller events. Hence, we highly recommend this Sabyasachi lehenga for the girls’ party.

Champakali lehenga - INR 3.45 lakhs

This one is the ideal sabyasachi bridal lehenga and till now tops our favorite’s list. The royal red Champakali Lehenga with golden embellishments shines like a diamond amid the coals. Well, it’s definitely wrong to term “coal” to any of his collections. It would feel like a scene straight out of a Banshali movie if the bride walks down to the stage wearing the red fire.

Ivory gold Sabyasachi lehenga - INR 3.95 lakhs

Image via @erinandtara

Floral lehenga - INR 3 lakhs

This lehenga is definitely perfect if one is getting married during Springs. Totally mingles with the ambience and mood. The floral lehengas won't have much glamorous designs but a soothing texture calming to the eyes. Many say it's not bridal enough, but absolutely one for wedding parties.

Firdaus lehenga in Dark Grey- INR 4.95 lakhs

Our choice definitely goes for the darker shades. The juxtaposition of deep coloured fabric with silver beads is what makes this Sabyasachi lehenga stand out from the crowd.

Image via @salwaphotography

Dil Guldasta lehenga - INR 8.50 lakhs

You must have already seen Deepika Padukone adorned with the Dil Guldasta lehenga. Needless to say, we get a whole Frida Kahlo vibe from there. No wonder it is a real hit amid the bride-to-be(s).

Image via Mili Ghosh Photography ★ 5

Anushka Sharma bridal lehenga - INR 8.75 lakhs

One of the top Google searches back in Virushka’s wedding was “Anushka Sharma Sabyasachi Lehenga price”, and “How much does Anushka Sharma’s lehenga cost?”. Because why not, it was damn pretty to make every girl fall in love with it. Now here is your answer. And no, it didn’t cost 1 crore as people were claiming.

Deepika Padukone bridal lehenga - INR 12 lakhs

Sabyasachi’s red elegance absolutely won our hearts when Deepika Padukone’s wedding pictures went viral. Netizens literally started comparing who wore it better: Deepika or Anuska? To clear up the confusion, DP’s lehenga cost was about 12 lakhs, and not some vague price.

Where to buy a Sabyasachi lehenga Online?

While there are numerous stores claiming to sell a Sabyasachi design but to buy an original Sabyasachi lehenga, these are the websites that you need to check out:

Carma Online

You can also find out all the details here

Looking To Inquire Sabyasachi Lehenga Price?

You will have to contact them for price information. Instead, head over to Carma Online- your best bet to know everything- from Sabyasachi lehenga price to details of the fabric. Apart from online, you can also head on to any of these Sabyasachi flagship stores to enquire about Sabyasachi lehenga price and even shop your dream wedding lehenga:

Kolkata

SABYASACHI, P- 545 Lake Road, Kolkata- 700029

Bridal Store, 80/ 1 & 2 Topsia Road, Kolkata – 700046

New Delhi

Sabyasachi Couture, Kutub Serai No 6-8, One Style Mile, Kalka Das Marg, Mehrauli, Near Qutub Minar, New Delhi- 110030

Mumbai

ICP Fort Heritage, Veer Nariman Road, Off Horniman Circle, Mumbai 400001

Hyderabad

New York

The Archive building at 160 Christopher Street

Sabyasachi Jewellery Dubai

Bayt Damas, Villa 1284, Al Wasl Rd, Umm Suqeim 3, Jumeirah, Dubai

If you are looking to buy Sabyasachi lehengas online, check out where you can buy them here.

What is the waiting time for a Sabyasachi lehenga?

The waiting time for a Sabyasachi lehenga is usually 3 months at the minimum, right from start to finish. So make sure you plan accordingly! The lehenga is curated as per your frame and size.

What about customised lehengas?

Customising a lehenga obviously costs more. But it is possible. You can request changes to the dupatta, the blouse etc, and they are done- that is the reason why you see so many brides rock lehengas that are similar but the blouse and dupatta might differ. Requests can be made, but since Sabyasachi Mukherjee approves every customisation himself, it's rare to get it done.

Can you mix and match and make a lehenga?

That's another no. You cannot mix and match the choli of one lehenga to the dupatta or skirt of another, unless and until you're buying three different lehengas. Sabyasachi lehengas are curated pieces, and there's no mixing and matching allowed. Customising is the only option.

Rent a Sabyasachi Lehenga

Well, not every bride who dreams to wear a Sabyasachi lehenga has the budget to buy it. And when you can't buy it, you rent it. Sabyasachi lehengas are now available for rent and this is the perfect solution to save some money while you wear your dream Sabyasachi lehenga. There are many online and offline stores that rent out designer bridal lehengas. We have listed down a few for you to check out.

Kuro

Flyrobe

The Style Ease

Rent an Attire

You can also choose to pick a pre-loved Sabyasachi lehenga for less on sites like

Kuro

Saritoria

Luxepolis

Now that you have a better idea about Sabyasachi lehenga price and more, does your dream lehenga seem more achievable now?

Please Note that the prices above might change with time.

Check out the latest bridal wear trends for more ideas and inspiration! Also, find more designer bridal lehengas here.
